Name: HMS Southwold
awards:
Battle honours for:
Sirte 1942
Malta Convoys 1942
Libya 1942
Fate: Hit a mine and sunk on 24 March 1942
Badge: On a Field Red, in front of two hunting horns in saltire Gold, a castle White
Displacement:
1,050 long tons (1,070 t) standard
1,430 long tons (1,450 t) full load
Propulsion:
2 Admiralty 3-drum boilers
2 shaft Parsons geared turbines, 19,000 shp (14,200 kW)
Speed:
27 knots (31 mph; 50 km/h)
25.5 kn (29.3 mph; 47.2 km/h) full
Armament:
6 × QF 4 in Mark XVI guns on twin mounts Mk. XIX
4 × QF 2 pdr Mk. VIII on quad mount MK.VII
2 × 20 mm Oerlikons on single mounts P Mk. III
110 depth charges, 2 throwers, 3 racks
